1_Germeval2018

Vorbereitung

library(tidyverse)
library(easystats)
library(tidymodels)
library(tidytext)  # Textmining
library(textrecipes)  # Textanalysen in Tidymodels-Rezepten
library(lsa)  # stopwords
library(discrim)  # naive bayes classification
library(naivebayes)
library(tictoc)  # Zeitmessung
library(fastrtext)  # Worteinbettungen
library(remoji)  # Emojis
library(tokenizers)  # Vektoren tokenisieren
library(syuzhet)
library(pradadata)
library(doParallel)
options(wc.cores = parallel::detectCores())

Datensätze

data("germeval_train") 

data("germeval_test")

data("sentiws")

data("schimpfwoerter")

data("wild_emojis", package = "pradadata")

d_train <- germeval_train
d_test <- germeval_test
names(d_train) <- c("id", "text", "c1", "c2")
wiki_de_embeds_path <- "/Users/chrissi/Dokumente/Angewandte Wirtschafts- und Medienpsychologie/WS 2023:24/Data Science 2/Wiki2Vec_German.txt"

wiki_de_embeds <-
  data.table::fread(file = wiki_de_embeds_path,
                    sep = " ",
                    header = FALSE,
                    showProgress = FALSE)
names(wiki_de_embeds)[1] <- "word"

wiki <- as_tibble(wiki_de_embeds)

Textanalyse

d_train %>% 
  count(c1)
       c1    n
1 OFFENSE 1688
2   OTHER 3321
d_train %>% 
  count(c2)
         c2    n
1     ABUSE 1022
2    INSULT  595
3     OTHER 3321
4 PROFANITY   71
train2 <-
  d_train %>% 
  mutate(text_length = str_length(text))

Durchschnittliche Textlänge:

train2 %>% 
  summarise(mean(text_length)) %>% round(0)
  mean(text_length)
1               142

tic()
senti2 <- get_sentiment(d_train$text,
              method = "custom",
              lexicon = sentiws) %>% 
  as_tibble()
toc()
8.613 sec elapsed

Schimpfwörter

train_long <- 
  d_train %>% 
  unnest_tokens(input = text, output = token)

d_schimpf <- 
  train_long %>% 
  select(id, token) %>% 
  mutate(schimpf = token %in% schimpfwoerter$word)

d_schimpf %>% 
  count(schimpf)
  schimpf     n
1   FALSE 99105
2    TRUE  1112
train3 <-
  train_long %>% 
  full_join(d_schimpf,relationship = "many-to-many") %>% 
  select(-c1, -c2)
Joining with `by = join_by(id, token)`
train3 %>% 
  dplyr::filter(schimpf == "TRUE") %>% 
  nrow()
[1] 1168
schimpfwoerter <- 
  schimpfwoerter %>% 
  mutate(value = 1)

Emojis

d_emojis <- 
  train2 %>% 
  select(id, text) %>% 
  mutate(wild_emoji = text %in% wild_emojis$emoji)


d_emojis %>% 
  filter(wild_emoji == "TRUE")
[1] id         text       wild_emoji
<0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)

Scheinbar keine Hass-Emojis

Tidymodels

Kreuzvalidierung

set.seed(42)
folds1 <- vfold_cv(train2, v = 5)

Rezept

rec1 <- 
  recipe(c1 ~ ., data = train2) %>% 
  update_role(id, new_role = "id")  %>% 
  update_role(c2, new_role = "ignore") %>% 
  step_mutate(n_schimpf = get_sentiment(text, method = "custom", lexicon = schimpfwoerter)) %>% 
  step_mutate(rsenti = get_sentiment(text, method = "custom", lexicon = sentiws)) %>% 
  step_tokenize(text) %>%
  step_stopwords(text, keep = FALSE, language = "de") %>%
  step_word_embeddings(text,
                       embeddings = wiki,
                       aggregation = "mean") %>%  
  step_zv() %>% 
  step_normalize(all_numeric_predictors())
rec1_prep <- prep(rec1, train2)

rec1_bake <- bake(rec1_prep, new_data = NULL)

head(rec1_bake)
# A tibble: 6 × 106
     id c2     text_length c1      n_schimpf  rsenti wordembed_text_V2
  <int> <fct>        <dbl> <fct>       <dbl>   <dbl>             <dbl>

Naive Bayes

nb_modell <- naive_Bayes() %>%
  set_mode("classification") %>%
  set_engine("naivebayes")

wf1 <-
  workflow() %>% 
  add_recipe(rec1) %>% 
  add_model(nb_modell)

tic()
fit1 <-
  fit_resamples(
    wf1,
    folds1,
    control = control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE)
  )
toc()
214.899 sec elapsed
wf1_performance <-
  collect_metrics(fit1)

wf1_performance
# A tibble: 2 × 6
  .metric  .estimator  mean     n std_err .config             
  <chr>    <chr>      <dbl> <int>   <dbl> <chr>               
1 accuracy binary     0.687     5 0.00199 Preprocessor1_Model1
2 roc_auc  binary     0.730     5 0.00427 Preprocessor1_Model1

Logistische Regression

lasso_modell <- logistic_reg(penalty = tune(), mixture = 1) %>%
  set_mode("classification") %>%
  set_engine("glmnet")

wf2 <- workflow() %>% 
  add_recipe(rec1) %>% 
  add_model(lasso_modell)

lambda_grid <- grid_regular(penalty(), levels = 5)  

tic()
fit2 <- 
  tune_grid(wf2, folds1, grid = lambda_grid, control = control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE))
toc()
177.093 sec elapsed
wf2_performance <- collect_metrics(fit2)

wf2_performance

Random Forest

rf_model <- 
  rand_forest(mtry = 3,
              min_n = tune(),
              trees = 1000) %>% 
  set_engine("ranger") %>% 
  set_mode("classification")

rf_wf <- 
  workflow() %>% 
  add_model(rf_model) %>% 
  add_recipe(rec1)

rf_grid <- 
  grid_regular(min_n(), levels = 4)

tic()
rf_fit <- 
  tune_grid(object = rf_wf, resamples = folds1, grid = rf_grid)
toc()
553.388 sec elapsed
show_best(rf_fit)
Warning: No value of `metric` was given; metric 'roc_auc' will be used.
# A tibble: 4 × 7
  min_n .metric .estimator  mean     n std_err .config             
  <int> <chr>   <chr>      <dbl> <int>   <dbl> <chr>               
1     2 roc_auc binary     0.784     5 0.00584 Preprocessor1_Model1
2    27 roc_auc binary     0.781     5 0.00565 Preprocessor1_Model3
3    40 roc_auc binary     0.780     5 0.00650 Preprocessor1_Model4
4    14 roc_auc binary     0.780     5 0.00685 Preprocessor1_Model2
rf_final_wf <- 
  rf_wf %>% 
  finalize_workflow(select_best(rf_fit))
Warning: No value of `metric` was given; metric 'roc_auc' will be used.

Fitten und Vorhersagen

fit_train <- 
  rf_final_wf %>% 
  fit(train2)

Vorbereitung Test-Datensatz

Textlänge

test2 <-
  d_test %>% 
  mutate(text_length = str_length(text))

Sentimentanalyse

senti_test <- get_sentiment(d_test$text,
              method = "custom",
              lexicon = sentiws) %>% 
  as_tibble()
test3 <- test2 %>% 
  bind_cols(value = senti_test$value) %>% 
  mutate(id = row_number())
fit_test <- 
  fit_train %>% 
  predict(test3)

Güte überprüfen

test4 <-
  test3 |> 
  bind_cols(fit_test) |> 
  mutate(c1 = as.factor(c1))
my_metrics <- metric_set(accuracy, f_meas)
my_metrics(test4,
           truth = c1,
           estimate = .pred_class)
# A tibble: 2 × 3
  .metric  .estimator .estimate
  <chr>    <chr>          <dbl>
1 accuracy binary         0.699
2 f_meas   binary         0.259
